column4: can anyone help me get flash and shockwave plugins for mizilla firefox?
on my gutsy install I just went to a site with flash and a wizard walked me through install the adobe flash 9 player
does going to a flash enabled site not bring up the wizard in firefox for you?
try that command from a terminal
sudo aptitude install flashplugin-nonfree
are you on a ubuntu systeM?
and yet you don't have aptitude? try "sudo apt-get install flashplugin-nonfree" then
im on a amd64 ubuntu system can installing flash plugins be hard on that?
very
adobe only makes a 32 bit flash player, I would google alot, it is a common issue
if i get x86 will it matter? will it solve my issues?
do you think i should get x86 ubuntu version?
I recommend that yes. The effect of actually running 64bit on the desktop is not worth it imho
im running x64 on a laptop will x86 work better than what i got?
it will avoid the issues you will have like with flash, there are many pages on the net talking about the differences and pros and cons
hmmm i got a AMD Turion 64 Mobile Technology with x64bit ubuntu running so u think x86 will make it go slow?
I already said that I think the small difference in performance is not worth the hassle on a desktop, that is also my opinion and to be taken with a grain of salt
most programs you will be running do not fully take advantage of 64bit anyway
so you saying try x86 right? sorry im new to this
for the third time, MY OPINION is that I would run x86 even on a 64 bit chip, if you want more info try google
thanks for the help
np
